title: Police: Cleaning pistols results in Venango County accidental shooting
content:
SANDYCREEK TOWNSHIP, Venango County — A 24-year-old Sandy Lake man was injured Sunday afternoon when he was accidentally shot in the leg by a 58-year-old Franklin man while the two were cleaning pistols, according to Pennsylvania State Police.
The incident took place at 900 Pioneer Road in Sandycreek Township around 1:15 p.m. Sunday, police said. The home is about two miles south of Franklin.
While tearing his 9 mm pistol apart, Franklin man accidentally fired the pistol with a bullet striking the Sandy Lake man’s leg, police said.
A family member drove the injured Sandy Lake man to UPMC Northwest in Seneca for medical treatment of non-life threatening injuries, police said. The Sandy Lake man was released after treatment, police said.
Police did not release the identity of either man.
